intro: Melananthus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered melanthus, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture and often have a distinct scent. Melananthus multiflorus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
